Viol Making Symposium

West Dean College, Friday March 26th, 2026

Friday, March 27th, 2026 at West Dean College, Sussex, UK and streamed online

09:15 to 18:00pm GMT

Second Viol Making Symposium at West Dean

After a successful first meeting in October 2024, we are pleased to announce a second meeting in March 2026, once again kindly hosted by West Dean College.

The agenda and recordings for the previous run are here.

Tickets are available now.

2026 Agenda

We are just finalising the agenda. Please subscribe to the mailing list to get notifications of updates.

Expect talks on Colichon construction, Busch and Hiltz viols and more.

09:15 - 09:30 Welcome and introduction, Old Dairy
09:30 - 10:45 Speaker 1 / Performance
Title 1
10:45 - 11:00 Coffee Break
11:00 - 11:45 Speaker 2
Title 2
11:45 - 12:30 Speaker 3
Title 3
12:30 - 14:00 Lunch in the main College
14:00 - 15:15 Speaker 4 and performance
Title 4
15:15 - 15:45 Tea Break
15:45 - 16:45 Short Talks
Titles TBD
16:45 - 18:00 Workshop tour
18:00 - 19:30 Dinner in the main College (please pre-book if you are staying for dinner)
19:45 - 21:30 Informal concert in the Oak Hall

Makers

There will be a table for makers to display instruments or bows. If you are attending and would like to bring along one instrument or a bow that you have made, please mention it when you book your ticket.

Location

The day is centred around the Old Dairy at West Dean College. Please use the West Dean Gardens entrance. Find West Dean Old Dairy on Google Maps

West Dean Gardens
Nr Chichester
West Sussex
PO18 0RX
